title: "This Week In React #192: Fog of War, react-html, Memory leaks, Suspense, security, chadcn/ui Charts, MUI, XR, Filament, Rise, Expo, React Navigation, Reanimated, Node, TypeScript, pnpm, Vitest..."

The newsletter is back after a well-deserved 2-weeks break!

translations.fr: La newsletter est de retour apr√®s une pause bien m√©rit√©e de deux semaines !
translations.en: La newsletter est de retour apr√®s une pause bien m√©rit√©e de deux semaines !

segments.source_content: So we're covering three weeks of news in one issue, and there are too many links to squeeze into one e-mail, so I had to filter out the news more aggressively. Despite the holiday season, we had a lot of great community React articles, and quite interesting React Native news!

translations.fr: Nous couvrons donc trois semaines d'actualit√©s en un seul num√©ro, avec tellement de liens qu'il a fallu filtrer plus s√©v√®rement pour tenir dans un e-mail. Malgr√© la p√©riode estivale, nous avons eu de nombreux excellents articles communautaires sur React et des nouvelles passionnantes sur React Native !
translations.en: Nous couvrons donc trois semaines d'actualit√©s dans un seul num√©ro, et il y a trop de liens √† inclure dans un seul e-mail, j'ai donc d√ª filtrer les nouvelles plus rigoureusement. Malgr√© la p√©riode des vacances, nous avons eu beaucoup d'excellents articles communautaires sur React, et des actualit√©s tr√®s int√©ressantes sur React Native !

segments.source_content: If you really like the exhaustive side of this newsletter, I'd encourage you to check the [online version](https://thisweekinreact.com/newsletter/192) this time: it exceptionally contains extra sections with twice more links that you might still find interesting. This also gives you a hint of the value I provide: the work you don't see is all the articles that I gathered and read/skimmed over and had to filter out.

translations.fr: Si vous appr√©ciez l'exhaustivit√© de cette newsletter, je vous encourage √† consulter la [version en ligne](https://thisweekinreact.com/newsletter/192) cette fois : elle contient exceptionnellement des sections suppl√©mentaires avec deux fois plus de liens qui pourraient vous int√©resser. Cela illustre aussi la valeur ajout√©e : le travail invisible de curation, lecture et filtrage des articles.
translations.en: Si vous appr√©ciez vraiment l'exhaustivit√© de cette newsletter, je vous encourage √† consulter la [version en ligne](https://thisweekinreact.com/newsletter/192) cette fois-ci : elle contient exceptionnellement des sections suppl√©mentaires avec deux fois plus de liens qui pourraient encore vous int√©resser. Cela vous donne aussi un aper√ßu de la valeur que j'apporte : le travail que vous ne voyez pas, ce sont tous les articles que j'ai rassembl√©s, lus/parcourus et que j'ai d√ª filtrer.

translations.fr: **[La Grille React D√©finissant une Nouvelle Cat√©gorie pour Votre Entreprise](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid)**

segments.source_content: Data grids are complex components of web applications, but current solutions are inefficient, require a lot of maintenance, and perform poorly. [Graphite Grid](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid) transforms the landscape with two key features: retargetable rendering and reactive signal state.

translations.fr: Les grilles de donn√©es sont des composants complexes d'applications web, mais les solutions actuelles sont inefficaces, co√ªteuses en maintenance et peu performantes. [Graphite Grid](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid) transforme ce paysage avec deux fonctionnalit√©s cl√©s : le rendu redirigeable et l'√©tat de signal r√©actif.
translations.en: Les grilles de donn√©es sont des composants complexes des applications web, mais les solutions actuelles sont inefficaces, n√©cessitent beaucoup de maintenance et offrent des performances m√©diocres. [Graphite Grid](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid) transforme le paysage avec deux fonctionnalit√©s cl√©s : le rendu redirigeable et l'√©tat de signal r√©actif.

segments.source_content: **Graphite Grid** separates grid state from view logic, allowing a single unified state model to support a variety of render targets, declaratively or imperatively. It includes a **DOM and Canvas** renderer, giving developers flexible, high-performance options üöÄ.

translations.fr: **Graphite Grid** s√©pare l'√©tat de la grille de la logique d'affichage, permettant √† un mod√®le d'√©tat unifi√© de supporter diverses cibles de rendu, de fa√ßon d√©clarative ou imp√©rative. Il inclut un moteur de rendu **DOM et Canvas**, offrant aux d√©veloppeurs des options flexibles et hautes performances üöÄ.
translations.en: **Graphite Grid** s√©pare l'√©tat de la grille de la logique d'affichage, permettant √† un mod√®le d'√©tat unifi√© unique de prendre en charge diverses cibles de rendu, de mani√®re d√©clarative ou imp√©rative. Il inclut un moteur de rendu **DOM et Canvas**, offrant aux d√©veloppeurs des options flexibles et hautes performances üöÄ.

segments.source_content: Graphite Grid is declarative and consistent, leveraging state signals to ensure seamless integration with your application. Designed with **React in mind**, it is the only JavaScript data grid built with React's state management primitives. [Try it now!](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid/demo)

translations.fr: Graphite Grid est d√©claratif et coh√©rent, utilisant des signaux d'√©tat pour une int√©gration transparente. Con√ßu **pour React**, c'est la seule grille JavaScript b√¢tie sur les primitives de gestion d'√©tat de React. [Essayez-la maintenant !](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid/demo)
translations.en: Graphite Grid est d√©claratif et coh√©rent, exploitant les signaux d'√©tat pour garantir une int√©gration transparente avec votre application. Con√ßu **en pensant √† React**, c'est la seule grille de donn√©es JavaScript construite avec les primitives de gestion d'√©tat de React. [Essayez-le maintenant !](https://1771technologies.com/graphitegrid/demo)

segments.source_content: We already featured this in our last issue, but there‚Äôs now a dedicated blog post that greatly explains what it‚Äôs all about. A new React Router feature enables you to split your route manifest in chunks. This article explains how it has been integrated in Remix 2.10 and what are the tradeoffs. It turns out a route manifest can grow quite large, and if you don‚Äôt split it, it might delay your app‚Äôs React hydration because it has to be downloaded upfront. If you have a medium/large Remix or React Router site, I‚Äôd recommend to check the size your route manifest immediately, and think about logical ways to split it, because the size reduction this new feature enable can have a significant perf impact. Shopify‚Äôs initial manifest went from 10MB to 1.9KB! The Docusaurus website manifest is also 200KB and I definitively plan to implement this.

translations.fr: D√©j√† √©voqu√© dans notre dernier num√©ro, un article d√©di√© explique d√©sormais ce sujet en d√©tail. Une nouvelle fonctionnalit√© de React Router permet de fragmenter le manifeste des routes. L'article d√©taille son int√©gration dans Remix 2.10 et les compromis associ√©s. Un manifeste de routes peut devenir volumineux, retardant l'hydratation React s'il est t√©l√©charg√© int√©gralement. Pour les sites Remix/React Router de taille moyenne/importante, v√©rifiez imm√©diatement la taille de votre manifeste et envisagez un d√©coupage logique : la r√©duction de taille peut √™tre significative (10Mo ‚Üí 1.9Ko chez Shopify !). Le manifeste de Docusaurus (200Ko) sera aussi optimis√©.
translations.en: Nous avions d√©j√† √©voqu√© cela dans notre dernier num√©ro, mais un article de blog d√©di√© explique d√©sormais en d√©tail le sujet. Une nouvelle fonctionnalit√© de React Router vous permet de fractionner votre manifeste de routes en morceaux. Cet article explique son int√©gration dans Remix 2.10 et les compromis impliqu√©s. Un manifeste de routes peut devenir tr√®s volumineux, et si vous ne le fragmentez pas, il peut retarder l'hydratation React de votre application car il doit √™tre t√©l√©charg√© au pr√©alable. Si vous avez un site Remix ou React Router de taille moyenne/grande, je vous recommande de v√©rifier imm√©diatement la taille de votre manifeste de routes et de r√©fl√©chir √† des moyens logiques de le fragmenter, car la r√©duction de taille permise par cette fonctionnalit√© peut avoir un impact significatif sur les performances. Le manifeste initial de Shopify est pass√© de 10 Mo √† 1,9 Ko ! Le manifeste du site Docusaurus fait aussi 200 Ko et je compte d√©finitivement impl√©menter cette solution.

It‚Äôs the successor of`renderToStaticMarkup`, supporting modern features like Suspense.
- üëÄ [React Core PR - `React.captureOwnerStack()`](http://github.com/facebook/react/pull/29923): From many PRs I see, a lot of effort is going on in the React repo to improve debugging, logging, and producing readable ‚Äúcomponent owner stack traces‚Äù. This new public API should be useful for framework authors to display an error dialog.
- üëÄ [Next.js PR - TypeScript config file (`next.config.ts`)](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/63051): A welcome improvement for DX to have first-class TypeScript support in config files, not anymore limited to JSDoc comments.
- üóìÔ∏è [React Rally](https://reactrally.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - üá∫üá∏ Utah - 12-13, August - Get a [10% discount](https://ti.to/react-rally/react-rally-2024/discount/TWIR) with code "TWIR". An awesome line up announced with Kent C. Dodds, Cory House, Joel Hooks, Tejas Kumar.
- üìú [Sneaky React Memory Leaks: How the React compiler won't save you](http://schiener.io/2024-07-07/react-closures-compiler): This closes a great 3-part series on memory leaks in React. Kevin found a case where using the React Compiler would actually introduce a memory leak to code that wouldn‚Äôt leak otherwise. Using bind might be a decent workaround. Note that these memory issues are not limited to React, but happen due to using functional programming and closures in JS in general.
- üìú [How to Simplify Component Imports with TypeScript Namespaces](https://sergiodxa.com/tutorials/simplify-component-imports-with-typescript-namespaces): I admit I didn‚Äôt know this quite pragmatic React + TypeScript trick that [Matt Pocock also approves](https://x.com/mattpocockuk/status/1805606072167940167).
- üìú [How to protect against a security breach in React Server Components](https://www.nodejs-security.com/blog/how-to-protect-against-a-security-breach-in-react-server-components): Greatly illustrates that validating with Zod is not enough, and it‚Äôs important to check access control for any server action input.
- üìú [WorkOS - Migrating to Next.js App Router with zero downtime](https://workos.com/blog/migrating-to-next-js-app-router-with-zero-downtime): An incremental migration from pages to App Router does not give a great navigation UX. They found a clever way to expose the same app as both Pages Router and App Router, with the ability to switch routers through a query string param.
- üìú [Enhancing The New York Times Web Performance with React 18](https://open.nytimes.com/enhancing-the-new-york-times-web-performance-with-react-18-d6f91a7c5af8): They migrated from React 16 and see great benefits such as fewer re-renders and improved INP score. Also encountered some challenges due to stricter hydration requirements.
- üìú [Learn Suspense by Building a Suspense-Enabled Library](https://www.bbss.dev/posts/react-learn-suspense/): Creates a suspense-enabled `useFetch()` hook to broadly demonstrate how real-world libraries work.

segments.source_content: The Margelo team released an impressive new real-time physically based 3D rendering engine for React Native, based on Google Filament. It‚Äôs GPU-accelerated by Metal/Vulkan, rendered on a separate thread, works with Reanimated, and already supports the New Architecture and Expo. The readme explains well how it differs from existing 3D solutions based on expo-gl (expo-three and react-three-fiber RN). With Skia and Filament, the future looks bright for React Native's 2D/3D capabilities.

translations.fr: L'√©quipe Margelo a publi√© un impressionnant nouveau moteur de rendu 3D en temps r√©el bas√© sur la physique pour React Native, fond√© sur Google Filament. Acc√©l√©r√© par GPU via Metal/Vulkan, rendu sur un thread s√©par√©, compatible avec Reanimated, et prenant d√©j√† en charge la Nouvelle Architecture et Expo. Le readme explique bien comment il diff√®re des solutions 3D existantes bas√©es sur expo-gl (expo-three et react-three-fiber RN). Avec Skia et Filament, l'avenir s'annonce prometteur pour les capacit√©s 2D/3D de React Native.
translations.en: L'√©quipe Margelo a lanc√© un nouveau moteur de rendu 3D bas√© physiquement en temps r√©el pour React Native, bas√© sur Google Filament. Il est acc√©l√©r√© par GPU via Metal/Vulkan, rendu sur un thread s√©par√©, fonctionne avec Reanimated, et prend d√©j√† en charge la Nouvelle Architecture et Expo. Le readme explique bien comment il diff√®re des solutions 3D existantes bas√©es sur expo-gl (expo-three et react-three-fiber RN). Avec Skia et Filament, l'avenir s'annonce prometteur pour les capacit√©s 2D/3D de React Native.

segments.source_content: A brand-new solution to create Server Driven UIs in React Native, that allows you to deploy new views on the server without rebuilding/resubmitting your app (or even ship an OTA update). It looks philosophically very close to the React Server Components model, but with slightly different tradeoffs: at the cost of some additional manual wiring, this new solution is framework and language agnostic thanks to a protocol that defines how views are serialized. It's still early days, but it looks promising.

translations.fr: Une toute nouvelle solution pour cr√©er des interfaces utilisateur pilot√©es par serveur dans React Native, permettant de d√©ployer de nouvelles vues c√¥t√© serveur sans reconstruire/resoumettre votre application (ni m√™me livrer une mise √† jour OTA). Philosophiquement tr√®s proche du mod√®le React Server Components, mais avec des compromis l√©g√®rement diff√©rents : au prix d'un c√¢blage manuel suppl√©mentaire, cette solution est agnostique vis-√†-vis du framework et du langage gr√¢ce √† un protocole d√©finissant la s√©rialisation des vues. Encore pr√©coce, mais prometteur.
translations.en: Une toute nouvelle solution pour cr√©er des interfaces utilisateur pilot√©es par serveur dans React Native, permettant de d√©ployer de nouvelles vues c√¥t√© serveur sans reconstruire/resoumettre votre application (ou m√™me diffuser une mise √† jour OTA). Elle est philosophiquement tr√®s proche du mod√®le des React Server Components, mais avec des compromis l√©g√®rement diff√©rents : au prix d'un c√¢blage manuel suppl√©mentaire, cette nouvelle solution est agnostique en termes de framework et de langage gr√¢ce √† un protocole d√©finissant la s√©rialisation des vues. C'est encore le d√©but, mais cela semble prometteur.

segments.source_content:
- üí∏ [RevenueCat Paywalls - Easy remotely configurable paywalls for React Native apps](https://www.revenuecat.com/docs/tools/paywalls?utm_medium=sponsored&utm_source=thisWeekInReact&utm_campaign=general_sponsorship&utm_content=revenuecat-paywalls)
- üì£ [React Native 0.76 - Android minSdk will bump to Android 7.0 (API 24)](https://github.com/react-native-community/discussions-and-proposals/discussions/802)
- üëÄ [More-reacty-native-demo](https://github.com/EvanBacon/more-reacty-native-demo): Evan Bacon experiments on exposing native views as lowercase intrinsic JSX elements that can be used directly without importing them, like divs on the web.
- üìñ [Reanimated Cookbook - Real-life examples to help you learn](https://docs.swmansion.com/react-native-reanimated/examples/)
- üóìÔ∏è [The Geek Conf](https://www.thegeekconf.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - üá©üá™ Berlin - 18 & 25 July - Get a 10% discount with code "TWIR". Last day tickets for tomorrow remote events !
- üìú [Expo - Increase iteration speed with PR previews](https://expo.dev/blog/increase-iteration-speed-with-pr-previews): New feature integrates EAS Updates with GitHub to automatically post OTA updates as PR commit status. A great DX, similar to what Vercel/Netlify offer on the web, but for mobile! My only wish is that they post a QRCode in a sticky PR comment.
- üìú [Use a framework to build React Native apps](https://reactnative.dev/blog/2024/06/25/use-a-framework-to-build-react-native-apps): The React Native team finally officially endorses the use of Expo! If you don‚Äôt use a framework, you are probably building one.
- üìú [From Web to Native with React](https://expo.dev/blog/from-web-to-native-with-react): Kadi from Expo created a great resource to help web devs learn React Native, including a comparison between intrinsic React DOM and React Native elements, how the flexbox model is a little bit different, errors to avoid, new native things to learn, and overall a great overview of anything to be aware of related to React Native or Expo.
- üìú [Microsoft - Building React Native for Windows Apps from a Mac](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/react-native/2024-07-18-running-rnw-from-a-mac-md/): Owning a Wndows PC is not required, and you can use a Windows VM through Microsoft Dev Box or Parallels.
- üìú [App clip with React Native and New Arch (and Swift)](<https://ospfranco.com/app-clip-with-react-native-and-new-arch-(and-swift)/>)
- üìú [Bringing native AI to your mobile apps with ExecuTorch - Part 2, Android](https://blog.swmansion.com/bringing-native-ai-to-your-mobile-apps-with-executorch-part-ii-android-29431b6b9f7f)
- üìú [Introduction to the React Native OMH Maps Library](https://www.callstack.com/blog/introduction-to-the-react-native-omh-maps-library)
- üì¶ [React Navigation 7.0 RC](https://reactnavigation.org/blog/2024/06/27/react-navigation-7.0-rc/): The final 7.0 release is coming, and I‚Äôm particularly excited by the Static API and the introduction of a screen preloading API. This is a first step toward great upcoming perceived performance improvements, that could later leverage upcoming Concurrent React features like notably `<Activity>`.
- üì¶ [FlashList 1.7 - New Architecture support!](https://github.com/Shopify/flash-list/releases/tag/v1.7.0)
- üì¶ [Yoga 3.1 - gap in %, layout conformance and regression fixes](https://www.yogalayout.dev/blog/announcing-yoga-3.1)
- üì¶ [Reanimated 3.13 - New Architecture, Tabs Shared Element Transitions](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-reanimated/releases/tag/3.13.0)
- üì¶ [React Native Primitives - Unstyled universal components with a focus on accessibility](https://github.com/roninoss/rn-primitives)

C'est une premi√®re √©tape vers d'importantes am√©liorations de performance per√ßue, qui pourraient exploiter les futures fonctionnalit√©s Concurrent React comme notamment `<Activity>`.
